title: LOKI: Has the MCU Been in a Time Loop This Whole Time? | KANG Marvel Theory
author: ScreenCrush
comment: If the MCU is in a time loop, who will finally break it?

Theory: What if the Nexus event on Lamentis wasn't Loki and Sylvie making a connection, but rather that Loki and Sylvie were going to perish which meant they would have never reached Kang to help break out of this time loop

The MCU is gone. 
We are now in the MCM: Marvel Cinematic Multiverse
This brings a new perspective to the sound of Tony making the Iron Man suit at the end of Engame's credits.

My theory is that the "threshold" they crossed, when Kang no longer knew what would happen, was the point he was killed in the previous loop. So every time Kang "glitched" when Sylvie tried to kill him was the "threshold" of a previous loop. So next time Kang lives through the loop his new "threshold" will be the point in time where we saw Sylvie kill him in the show.
description:
Loki's season finale gave us some answers, but left us with even more questions. Has He Who Remains made this offer to a different Loki and Sylvie, in a different timeline? How many times has there been a multiversal war? And finally, what does this mean for Kang and the Marvel Cinematic Universe?

If you're new, Subscribe! →
